title: How to be a good neighbor when you are living in an Apartment
description: Living with a neighbour who blasts music intentionally and gives you snide comments and dirty looks is a nightmare that has no end as neither your neighbour nor you are going anywhere anytime soon. Life in an apartment with bad neighbours can be miserable and stressful.
excerpt: Living with a neighbour who blasts music intentionally and gives you snide comments and dirty looks is a nightmare[...]
author: John Doe

content.text: Living with a neighbour who blasts music intentionally and gives you snide comments and dirty looks is a nightmare that has no end as neither your neighbour nor you are going anywhere anytime soon. Life in an apartment with bad neighbours can be miserable and stressful. You see them every day.
Good neighbor relations are essential for maintaining a peaceful and enjoyable living environment in apartment complexes. Here are some practical tips to help you be a good neighbor:
Respect Noise Levels
Keep music and TV volumes at reasonable levels, especially during late hours. Be mindful of your footsteps and avoid loud activities during quiet hours (typically 10 PM to 8 AM).
Maintain Common Areas
Keep hallways, elevators, and common spaces clean. Don't leave personal belongings in shared areas and dispose of trash properly.
Be Friendly and Respectful
Greet your neighbors with a smile. Be respectful of their privacy and personal space. Avoid prying into their affairs or spreading gossip.
Control Odors and Pests
Ensure proper ventilation in your unit to minimize cooking odors. Keep your space clean to prevent pest infestations that could spread to neighboring units.

title: 20 Space Management Tips Every Sri Lankan Apartment Owner Should Know
description: Apartment living gives you more freedom, privacy, facilities and security. Space management is a crucial point many apartment owners get stuck at.
excerpt: Apartment living gives you more freedom, privacy, facilities and security. Regardless of all these advantages apartment living can offer you, space management is a crucial point[...]
author: John Doe

content.text: Apartment living gives you more freedom, privacy, facilities and security. Regardless of all these advantages apartment living can offer you, space management is a crucial point many apartment owners get stuck at. And this is one of the main reason people who is looking forward to investing in an apartment in Sri Lanka reconsider their choices.

But finding room for all the stuff you own is not impossible when you have few tips and hacks up in your sleeve. In this post, we put together 20 tips that can help you in space management, so you can find a space for all the most essential things you need.
20 Space Management Tips

items: Looking for dual or multi-purpose furniture.
Donate anything you did not use for the past year. You can survive without it.
Furniture with legs is the best for a small space as they give the illusion of a bigger space.
Buy a coffee table with drawers.
Less is more. So, invest only in few pieces of furniture and accessories.
Find a good carpenter to build you a customize above-the-door shelf to store extra bathroom products in your bathroom.
Invest in folding furniture.
Make sure to give every item a home (basket, container…etc.) and every function a place.
When you are arranging furniture makes sure not to block views of windows and doors.
Utilize the corners wisely. Add some corner shelves or find small pieces of furniture that can store stuff.
Use the space behind the doors to hang thin items such as towels.
Attach small hooks to your cupboard doors to hang small items like spoons.
Invest in wall-to-wall and floor-to-ceiling cabinets that fit your space.
Buy one or two taller pieces like a bookshelf which can help you give your space a more height while providing you with more storage space.
Consider adding some ceiling shelves.
Clear furniture can do wonders.
Over-the-sink cutting board can temporarily expand your counter space.
Maximize your under-sink storage space.
Invest in small baskets or boxes to add to your open storage shelf. This can make things more organized.
Don't use every square inch. Because your eyes need a rest.
